items.description: Protective clothing commonly used in laboratories to shield the body from spills and hazards.
items.feedback: Great choice! A full-length cotton lab coat protects your skin and clothes from spills.

items.description: A full-body protective garment designed to safeguard against hazardous materials, chemicals, or infectious agents.
items.feedback: Not quite. Hazmat suits are overkill for general lab work and can be cumbersome for everyday experiments.

items.description: A heavy-duty apron made from flame-resistant material, used to shield the body from sparks, heat, and open flames.
items.feedback: Close, but fire aprons are mainly for welding or flame-intensive tasks, not typical lab experiments.

tip: Did you know? Lab coats are flame-resistant and protect against minor chemical splashes.
